entry.title: Russia rejects Azerbaijan‚Äôs demand for Lachin corridor checkpoints

media:group.media:title: Russia rejects Azerbaijan‚Äôs demand for Lachin corridor checkpoints
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenian Parliament Speaker Alen Simonyan announced that Yerevan and Baku have reached a ‚Äúconsensus‚Äù on a number of ‚Äúinternationally accepted‚Äù points in a possible peace agreement. üìçRussian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov dismissed Baku‚Äôs calls for checkpoints along the sole road connecting Armenia and Karabakh following talks with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev. üìçBaku launched first-of-its-kind legal proceedings against Yerevan under a 1994 energy treaty, alleging that Armenia violated international law by running hydroelectric power plants in Karabakh.

entry.title: Russian migrants to stay in Armenia for another year at least, S&P expects

media:group.media:title: Russian migrants to stay in Armenia for another year at least, S&P expects
media:group.media:description:
üìçRussia‚Äôs peacekeepers in Karabakh convened direct talks Saturday between the Azerbaijani and Karabakh Armenian authorities, with the two sides reaching an agreement to restore the region‚Äôs supplies of natural gas and electricity. üìçS&P Global Ratings has raised the Armenian government‚Äôs credit outlook to ‚Äúpositive‚Äù from ‚Äústable,‚Äù just weeks after Fitch Ratings announced a similar upgrade. Both agencies cited last year‚Äôs influx of tens of thousands of Russians as a major factor.
Credits: Ruptly
